title: Shuwen Zhang
text:
Shuwen Zhang





I am currently a Ph.D. candidate in the Department of Public Administration at the University of Illinois at Chicago. My research focuses on collaborative governance, regional intergovernmental organizations, and social network analysis. My research primarily investigates the mechanisms through which governments collaboratively address complex, cross-boundary challenges. I focus on the dynamics of decentralized local systems and their networks, probing how local governments utilize diverse institutional arrangements to tackle issues beyond local administrative limits.





I am also a member of the Network and Governance Lab with a bunch of awesome researchers diving into all sorts of cool stuff! Check out our lab’s website to see the amazing research we’re up to!


Peer-reviewed Articals
Zhang, S., & Zehra, M.-E.-. (2024). Exploring Accountability Choices in Service Contracts for Collaborative PublicSafetyServices Provision. State and Local Government Review, 56(1), 6-25. https://doi.org/10.1177/0160323X231208958
Zhang, S.; Li, J. & Carr, J. Relational Contracting thru Selection-Based Accountability: Collaboration History, Shared Constituencies, and Justified Trust in Public Safety Contracts. Under Review at Public Performance & Management Review


Teaching
Instructor - PPOL205: Programming and Data Analysis for public policy II. (Jan. 2023-May. 2023; Jan. 2024- Present).


Awards
Donald C. Stone Award for Best Student Paper from the Section on Intergovernmental Administration and Management at American Society for Public Administration Annual Conference (Apr. 2023)
